data.title: Added the Tiberian Sun docking overlays
data.body: will need some tweaking afterwards.

data.title: Replace hardcoded Prone and DeathType warhead properties with a generic "Types" list
data.body:
Our warhead code is still a twisty mess, with a `DamageWarhead` class that contains a bunch of mod-specific concepts (like infantry prone and death types) hardcoded in the game assembly.

We can untangle these by defining a `Types` field that defines a list of tags (like we do for target types) that the `INotifyDamaged` consumers can query.

For example, a warhead that current defines `DeathType: 5` (fire) would define `Types: fire`, and `WithDeathAnimation` can define a dictionary of type → sequence (with a default defined on ^Infantry, so there's no gruntwork involved).  Prone modifiers can be similarly reversed: instead of the warhead saying "I do 50% damage against prone actors" the `TakesCover` trait can say "I take 50% damage against types x,y,z while prone".

Once this is done we should be able to implement a simple `IWarhead` interface to replace the `DamageWarhead` references in the engine code and finish the warhead decoupling that started with #6030.

data.title: Fix mine visibility and autotarget.
Mines are visible through the fog for one tick after they are placed.
data.body:

data.title: Red Alert: Attack move shows mine location
data.body:
When a player builds a minelayer and lays mines for the enemy, the enemy will be able to see the location of the mines when Attack moving.
- Build minelayer
- Lay mines
- Enemy player will Attack Move to the enemy base
- Enemy units will target mine locations when refreshing Attack Move Command if a mine is close
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/11588504-red-alert-attack-move-shows-mine-location?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Made sure spice blooms are drawn below harvesters
data.body: Increased negative ZOffset to a full cell, this should fix that harvesters (and other larger actors) are drawn below the bloom art when moving around the upper half of the bloom.

data.title: Fix random country display.
data.body: This fixes the earlier issues without overriding PlayerReference values with different state.

data.title: Updated Monster Tank Madness
data.body:
... to use `OnPlayerDiscovered`.

Also added a new line at the end of some descriptions for better readability.

data.title: Fixed the offsets for Tiberian Sun transformable units
data.body:
Fixes #5906 though it seems already fixed as the issue is old. We just used incorrect offset values here as far as I see it. Those may have worked around isometric perspective problems in the past. I don't remember. Anyway, this tweaks them.

Also for some reason the lightning of the artillery voxel is quite different compared to http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Artillery_(Tiberian_Sun) and the sprite so I essentially did the opposite of https://github.com/Phrohdoh/oramod-ra2/pull/56/ to fix it.

data.title: Fix an issue in EnemyWatcher.cs
data.body:
Previously the first scan could only occur after 750 ticks and was blocked
for another 750 ticks after a notification played.

data.title: Adjust IRadarSignature to support per-cell colors.
data.body: For use primarily by the new map editor.

data.title: Added the Tiberian Sun Nod Obelisk charge animation
data.body: I was forced to do a lot of cleanup, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing.

data.title: Added the amphibious mode to the Tiberian Sun APC
data.body: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/7218560/f5afb232-e676-11e4-8da7-094f59defff3.png)

data.title: Remove RenderSprites animation keys.
data.body: The code that previously required these was removed ages ago, and they now just cause problems (duplicate key exceptions when adding multiple traits).  Conflicts with several existing prs.

data.title: Fixed the Dune 2000 harvester sand out animation
data.body: using a new blend mode from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7811 to make it look more like the original.

data.title: Fix orcas flying sequences.
data.body: Fixes #7889.  Conflicts with #7887 (sigh).

data.title: RA road minimap color is wrong
data.body:
The minimap shows roads as brown, but they are actually more grey.  This is most visibly bogus where roads pass over bridges (which show the correct color).

![road](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/7218024/c7e80a8e-e6a8-11e4-9a4b-35aaae45cc5b.png)

data.title: Linux performance problem rendering menu
data.body:
The game itself plays mostly fine. However when opening the menu, especially the input tab, the frame rate drops tremendously. This issue only exists on Linux.
Note that I have hardly any CPU or GPU usage. The nvidia driver is slightly older on Linux, but the game ran fine on windows back when it also had the older nvidia driver. So I doubt that the problem can be fixed with a simple driver update. 

These screenshots illustrate the problem:
http://i.imgur.com/A7WukI1.png

My pref.log:
http://paste.ee/r/hIVZ6

It could be related to this problem:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=15660&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0

Some system stats:
software  
- Linux manjaro 3.19.3-1-MANJARO #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Mar 26 19:16:03 UTC 2015 x86_64 GNU/Linux  
- Mono JIT compiler version 3.12.1 (tarball Thu Mar 12 06:31:20 UTC 2015)  
- openra release-20141029  
- NVIDIA Driver Version: 346.47  

Hardware  
- Nvidia GeForce GTX 960  
- Intel i7-4790k @ 4Ghz  
- 8GB ram

data.title: Fix RGB map previews
Infantry go to repair pad along with damaged vehicles
data.body:
Playtest 20150408
Group infantry and vehicles, send the group to a repair pad. The undamaged vehicles stay, the damaged vehicles go, and so do the optimistic infantry.
